description: Clarion data type definitions for signature help and IntelliSense

parameters.name: initial_value
parameters.description: The initial value of the BYTE variable

parameters.name: initial_value
parameters.description: The initial value of the SHORT variable

parameters.name: initial_value
parameters.description: The initial value of the USHORT variable

parameters.name: initial_value
parameters.description: The initial value of the LONG variable

parameters.name: initial_value
parameters.description: The initial value of the ULONG variable

parameters.name: initial_value
parameters.description: The initial value of the SREAL variable

parameters.name: initial_value
parameters.description: The initial value of the REAL variable

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: Total number of decimal digits (max 31)

parameters.name: places
parameters.description: Number of decimal digits in fractional portion. If omitted, variable is declared as math-based integer

parameters.name: initial_value
parameters.description: The initial value of the DECIMAL variable

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: Total number of decimal digits (max 31)

parameters.name: places
parameters.description: Number of decimal digits in fractional portion

parameters.name: initial_value
parameters.description: The initial value of the PDECIMAL variable

dataTypes.name: STRING

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: Number of bytes in string, or string constant, or picture token for formatting. Can be a variable-sized expression in local scope

dataTypes.notes: Implicitly declared as STRING(1),DIM(length) for character-level access. Supports string slicing [start:end]

dataTypes.name: CSTRING

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: Number of bytes including null terminator, or string constant, or picture token

dataTypes.notes: Compatible with C language strings and Btrieve ZSTRING. Implicitly supports array-style access

dataTypes.name: PSTRING
dataTypes.description: Pascal-style string with embedded length byte

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: Number of bytes (max 255), or string constant, or picture token. First byte stores length

dataTypes.notes: Compatible with Pascal strings. First byte contains string length

dataTypes.name: ASTRING
dataTypes.notes: Reference-counted, automatically manages memory. Thread-safe for multiple references

dataTypes.name: DATE

parameters.name: initial_value
parameters.description: The initial value of the DATE variable (Clarion standard date)

dataTypes.notes: Standard Clarion date (days since December 28, 1800). Use DATE() function to get current date

dataTypes.name: TIME

parameters.name: initial_value
parameters.description: The initial value of the TIME variable (centiseconds since midnight)

dataTypes.notes: Centiseconds since midnight (0-8639999). Use CLOCK() function to get current time

dataTypes.name: MEMO
dataTypes.description: Variable-length text field for large text data

parameters.name: max_length
parameters.description: Maximum length in bytes. If omitted, defaults to 64K

dataTypes.notes: Used for large text fields. Must be last field in RECORD if over 64K. File driver support required

dataTypes.name: BLOB
dataTypes.description: Binary Large Object for variable-length binary data

parameters.name: max_length
parameters.description: Maximum length in bytes. Can exceed 64K if supported by file driver

dataTypes.notes: Used for large binary data (images, documents). Must be last field in RECORD if over 64K

dataTypes.name: ANY
dataTypes.notes: Can hold reference to any data type. Typically used for polymorphic parameters

dataTypes.name: GROUP
dataTypes.description: Declares a group of related fields (structure)

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: The label of a previously declared GROUP or QUEUE from which to inherit structure. Can reference a GROUP or QUEUE with TYPE attribute.

dataTypes.notes: Groups fields into a structure. Can inherit from another GROUP using GROUP(basegroup). Fields declared between GROUP and END. Can be used as a data type when TYPE attribute is present. Supports nested groups.

dataTypes.name: QUEUE

parameters.name: group
parameters.description: The label of a previously declared GROUP, QUEUE, or RECORD from which to inherit structure. Can have or not have TYPE attribute.

dataTypes.notes: Dynamic table structure with ADD/DELETE operations. Can inherit from GROUP using QUEUE(basegroup). Fields declared between QUEUE and END. Memory is dynamically allocated/freed. Can be used as a data type when TYPE attribute is present.

dataTypes.name: CLASS

parameters.name: parentclass
parameters.description: The label of a parent CLASS from which to inherit structure and methods. Derived class inherits all data members and methods from parent.

dataTypes.notes: Object-oriented class declaration. Can inherit from base class using CLASS(baseclass). Contains properties (data) and methods (procedures). Supports PRIVATE, PROTECTED, and PUBLIC visibility. Must end with END statement.

dataTypes.name: FILE
dataTypes.description: Declares a file structure for data storage
dataTypes.notes: File declaration with DRIVER, RECORD, and KEY sections. DRIVER specifies file type (TOPSPEED, ASCII, BASIC, DOS, etc.). Contains RECORD for fields and KEY for indexes. Must specify DRIVER attribute.

dataTypes.name: RECORD
dataTypes.description: Declares a record structure within a FILE
dataTypes.notes: Defines the record layout within a FILE declaration. Contains field definitions between RECORD and END. Typically follows KEY declarations in FILE structure.

dataTypes.name: VIEW

parameters.name: primary_file
parameters.description: The primary file for the view

dataTypes.notes: Declares a relational view joining multiple files. Contains PROJECT for field selection and JOIN for related files. Provides SQL-like relational queries in Clarion.

dataTypes.name: INTERFACE
dataTypes.notes: Defines an interface that classes can implement. Contains method prototypes without implementation. Classes implementing the interface must provide all method implementations.

dataTypes.name: MODULE

parameters.name: module_name
parameters.description: The name of the external module

dataTypes.notes: References an external compiled module. Used with CLASS to specify implementation location. The module must be linked at compile/link time.
